projects.title: Wellness Companian
projects.blurb: A mental wellness app built with React Native, TypeScript, and Supabase, featuring mood tracking, gratitude journaling, goal setting, meditation, and analytics to help users build healthier habits.

projects.title: USA Natural Disaster Predictor
projects.blurb: This project is a web application that predicts the likelihood of natural disasters occurring in the USA based on historical FEMA data. It provides visualizations of predicted disasters on a map, in a bar chart, and in a table format.

projects.title: Vagabond Connect
projects.blurb: Full Stack Social Media Web app with CRUD functionality created with MERN (React, TypeScript, NodeJS, Express, and MongoDB). Uses Socket.io for live messanging and notificatons update.

projects.title: Admin Metrics Dashboard
projects.blurb: Admin dashboard for managers and team leads to visualize employee performance with interactive charts and graphs created with D3.js. Reads data from a database with live updates on employee metrics.

projects.title: Suay Resort
projects.blurb: Hotel Booking website with a database for bookings created using the MERN stack. Users can manage bookings and are alerted if a room is full or available at a specified date.

work.title: frontend developer
duties: Led development of reusable Web Components infrastructure using Storybook and TypeScript, reducing redundant code by 80% and reducing client-facing errors by 40%.
Created an internal metrics dashboard using Web Components and Google Apps Script, enabling team leads to efficiently analyze designer performance, resulting in more meaningful peer feedback.
Sole US-based dev for a client-facing frontend product, handling 100% of urgent fixes & red alerts.
Trained and onboarded developers into the updated Web Components system, ensuring seamless integration.
Utilized HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, and D3.js to build interactive data visualizations for our platform.
Partnered with designers to optimize API data usage, reducing designer errors by 40%, leading to fewer revisions and faster project completion
